sense.name: (Cause to) move away from one another or in different directions; throw or give off from a central point.
sense.examples: The crowds slowly dissipated. She waved her hand and dissipated the throngs of supporters. The liver would have dissipated the alcohol. For a start, the alcohol dissipates during the manufacturing process.

sense.name: Become less intense or less apparent; eliminate.
sense.examples: Darman suggests such tensions will dissipate quickly. The tremendous energy of the quake was dissipated by the distance. The body can dissipate one drink an hour.

sense.name: Live in a frivolous manner, especially with regard to alcoholic consumption.
sense.examples: There is a hypothesis that wives typically dissipate their inheritance. He simply dissipated for a number of years.
